verses.esv: 7 for we walk by faith, not by sight.
verses.kjv: 7 (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)
verses.niv: 7 We live by faith, not by sight.

verses.esv:
5   Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv:
8   He has told you, O man, what is good;
    and what does the LORD require of you
  but to do justice, and to love kindness,
    and to walk humbly with your God?
verses.kjv: 8 He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?
verses.niv: 8 He has showed you, O man, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.

verses.esv: 33 You shall walk in all the way that the LORD your God has commanded you, that you may live, and that it may go well with you, and that you may live long in the land that you shall possess.
verses.kjv: 33 Ye shall walk in all the ways which the LORD your God hath commanded you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with you, and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.
verses.niv: 33 Walk in all the way that the LORD your God has commanded you, so that you may live and prosper and prolong your days in the land that you will possess.

verses.esv:
Nun

105   Your word is a lamp to my feet
    and a light to my path.
verses.kjv: 105 Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
verses.niv: 105 Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path.

verses.esv: 9 These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation. Noah walked with God.
verses.kjv: 9 These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.
verses.niv: 9 This is the account of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time, and he walked with God.

verses.esv:
3   “Do two walk together,
    unless they have agreed to meet?
verses.kjv: 3 Can two walk together, except they be agreed?
verses.niv: 3 Do two walk together unless they have agreed to do so?

verses.esv: 10 For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.
verses.kjv: 10 For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.
verses.niv: 10 For we are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.

verses.esv: 16 But I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh.
verses.kjv: 16 This I say then, Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh.
verses.niv: 16 So I say, live by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the sinful nature.

verses.esv: 7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
verses.kjv: 7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
verses.niv: 7 Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

verses.esv:
133   Keep steady my steps according to your promise,
    and let no iniquity get dominion over me.
verses.kjv: 133 Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
verses.niv: 133 Direct my footsteps according to your word; let no sin rule over me.

verses.esv: 7 “Thus says the LORD of hosts: If you will walk in my ways and keep my charge, then you shall rule my house and have charge of my courts, and I will give you the right of access among those who are standing here.
verses.kjv: 7 Thus saith the LORD of hosts; If thou wilt walk in my ways, and if thou wilt keep my charge, then thou shalt also judge my house, and shalt also keep my courts, and I will give thee places to walk among these that stand by.
verses.niv: 7 "This is what the LORD Almighty says: 'If you will walk in my ways and keep my requirements, then you will govern my house and have charge of my courts, and I will give you a place among these standing here.

verses.esv: 24 Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him.
verses.kjv: 24 And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.
verses.niv: 24 Enoch walked with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.

verses.esv: 6 Therefore, as you received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in him,
verses.kjv: 6 As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him:
verses.niv: 6 So then, just as you received Christ Jesus as Lord, continue to live in him,

verses.esv: 12:1 Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us,
verses.kjv: 1 Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
verses.niv: 1 Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles, and let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.

verses.esv: 13 Let us walk properly as in the daytime, not in orgies and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and sensuality, not in quarreling and jealousy.
verses.kjv: 13 Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.
verses.niv: 13 Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in orgies and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not in dissension and jealousy.

verses.esv: 8 Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
verses.kjv: 8 Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.
verses.niv: 8 Come near to God and he will come near to you. Wash your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.

verses.esv: 21 And your ears shall hear a word behind you, saying, “This is the way, walk in it,” when you turn to the right or when you turn to the left.
verses.kjv: 21 And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.
verses.niv: 21 Whether you turn to the right or to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, "This is the way; walk in it."

verses.esv: 6 whoever says he abides in him ought to walk in the same way in which he walked.
verses.kjv: 6 He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.
verses.niv: 6 Whoever claims to live in him must walk as Jesus did.

verses.esv: 22 Enoch walked with God after he fathered Methuselah 300 years and had other sons and daughters. 23 Thus all the days of Enoch were 365 years. 24 Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him.
verses.kjv: 22 And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters: 23 And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years: 24 And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.
verses.niv: 22 And after he became the father of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years and had other sons and daughters. 23 Altogether, Enoch lived 365 years. 24 Enoch walked with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.

verses.esv: 5 By faith Enoch was taken up so that he should not see death, and he was not found, because God had taken him. Now before he was taken he was commended as having pleased God.
verses.kjv: 5 By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
verses.niv: 5 By faith Enoch was taken from this life, so that he did not experience death; he could not be found, because God had taken him away. For before he was taken, he was commended as one who pleased God.

verses.esv: 7 But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.
verses.kjv: 7 But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.
verses.niv: 7 But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.

verses.esv: 8 Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
verses.kjv: 8 He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.
verses.niv: 8 Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love.

verses.esv:
21   “Agree with God, and be at peace;
    thereby good will come to you.
verses.kjv: 21 Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
verses.niv: 21 "Submit to God and be at peace with him; in this way prosperity will come to you.

verses.esv: 4 We were buried therefore with him by baptism into death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, we too might walk in newness of life.
verses.kjv: 4 Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.
verses.niv: 4 We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
